title: You have struck a rock
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Blacks - South Africa
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Political science
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/South Africa - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Women - Social conditions
description: 'You have touched a woman, you have struck a rock!' was the cry in 1956 when 20,000 women occupied Union Buildings, the seat of the all-white South African government, to protest against the issuing of passes to black women. The film recreates this anti-apartheid womens' campaign using a collage of rare photographs, newsreel footage and recent interviews with women involved.
